messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On December 18, DET. J. L. Morton responded to a call from the Lakeside Motel regarding a theft. Witnesses included Mr. Davidson, the motel manager, and Ms. Clark, a guest from Room 204. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. P. R. Collins - OPERATIONS Det. Morton, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS HARPER 20:05 Theft Mr. Davidson reported a missing television from the lobby. Ms. Clark claimed to have seen a suspicious individual near the entrance around midnight. Hand. Technician Emily was on duty for the Crime Lab. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Morton Jr OPERATIONS Lt. Collins INFORMANT Clark, Lucy 89 Birch Road, Laketown, Delaware 120-405. 90618. HARPER 20:05 Theft By 5:15 PM, Detective Morton and Lieutenant Collins, from the Laketown Police Department, gathered all witness statements. Captain S. T. Wilson reviewed the initial findings. Sergeant M. L. Turner will be investigating pawn shops for the missing television. At 6:00 PM, the evidence, including CCTV footage, was submitted for review. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Morton Jr Lt. Collins AFFIDAVIT - Search or Seizure 1) CCTV Footage 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Evidence Collection Form 5) Motel Registration Logs (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE L. Foster L.P.D. 4.30 P18 0679 Davidson, MARK NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 50-9923 DETECTIVE: J. MORTON ITEM: 18-4155- 81 CRIME: 20:05 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 80590 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 6/02/22 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. J. L. Morton  Officer Context: On December 18, DET. J. L. Morton responded to a call from the Lakeside Motel regarding a theft. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. P. R. Collins  Officer Context: Lt. P. R. Collins - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Technician Emily  Officer Context: Hand. Technician Emily was on duty for the Crime Lab. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Morton  Officer Context: By 5:15 PM, Detective Morton and Lieutenant Collins, from the Laketown Police Department, gathered all witness statements. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain S. T. Wilson  Officer Context: Captain S. T. Wilson reviewed the initial findings. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant M. L. Turner  Officer Context: Sergeant M. L. Turner will be investigating pawn shops for the missing television. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Lieutenant Collins  Officer Context: By 5:15 PM, Detective Morton and Lieutenant Collins, from the Laketown Police Department, gathered all witness statements. Officer Role: Lieutenant
